document_data.name: Zelphar Thann
document_data.mainbody: '''Zelphar Thann''' was the fourth son of [[Rhammas Thann|Rhammas]] and [[Cassandra Thann]] of [[Waterdeep]] and an older brother of [[Danilo Thann]]. He served as [[Tethyr]]'s Count of [[Rivershire]] and Estate Chancellor. He was in charge of public works and maintained the siegeworks in the [[Tethyrian Interregnum#Reclamation Wars|Reclamation Army]]. However, his passion was wine, so he took care of most of his family's vineyards in the south.
document_data.Personality: Zelphar Thann was known to be quiet, thoughtful, and reserved, which made him appear weak and ineffective. He was well aware of how he was perceived and preferred to use others' misconceptions to his advantage.
document_data.Abilities: Not only was Lord Zelphar a superb [[architect]], but he was also an excellent leader, managing the county assigned to him well in spite of his unpopularity with the landed families. (Of the seven land-owning families of Rivershire, only two of them liked the new count.)
document_data.Holdings: Count Thann's manor was [[Lhestyn's Hearth]], which he named after his [[Lhestyn|grandmother]]. Zelphar redesigned the formerly abandoned manor's defenses. It was twelve miles north of [[Darromar]].
document_data.Activities: As Estate Chancellor of Tethyr, Count Zelphar Thann was responsible for the building and maintenance of all public works—public buildings, defenses, roads, bridges, ''etc.''—which made him one of the most popular officials in the eyes of the common people. His role extends to military engineering projects as well. Thus, when [[Zaranda Star|Queen Zaranda]] sent her army to [[Riatavin]] after that city defected from [[Amn]], Zelphar was sent along with them as an advisor.
document_data.Relationships:
Zelphar was a member of the famous [[House Thann]] of Waterdeep, but as a [[Tethyrian]] he was swayed by [[Haedrak Rhindaun III|Prince Haedrak]] to join in the latter's quest to retake the throne of Tethyr. His family provided 200 cavalry and 2,000 pikemen for the cause.

Haedrak, and later Zaranda Star, tried hard to set up Zelphar with [[Perendra Raslemtar]]. The two nobles did grow very fond of each other, yet their shyness and business meant the relationship progressed more slowly than the royal couple would have liked.

Zelphar was a friend of [[Kyrin Hawkwinter]], and he was responsible for fortifying her keep of [[Daraqadim]].
document_data.Rumors:
It was rumored that the Qonsir family, led by Lord Tedeo Qonsir, was trying to unify the other families of Rivershire against Zelphar by making the accusation that his relationship with Lady Perendra was simply a ploy to gain standing with the queen.

Zelphar was a member of the [[Merchant's Chosen]] of Riatavin, which made him a target for the [[Shadow Thieves]].
